intro: Incarvillea mairei f. multifoliolata, commonly known as the multilobe incarvillea, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, finely divided leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is adapted to well-drained soils. Its foliage and floral structure make it a unique addition to horticultural collections.
